title: Man accused of Colchester triple murder spits at public gallery as he appears in court
text:

A man accused of a triple murder spat at the public gallery behind the reinforced glass of the dock when he appeared in court.

Tom Saunders, 32, did not enter a plea in Colchester Magistrates' Court and spoke only to confirm his name and age.

Saunders, of Bounstead Road, in Colchester, had a bandaged right arm and wore a prison-issue grey tracksuit.

He stood in court with his arms folded as the charges were read out.

He was not asked for pleas for three counts of murder and possession of an offensive weapon in a public space.

Saunders appeared in court after police found three bodies in Colchester, Essex, in the early hours of Sunday morning.

Police identified the deceased men as Danny Gibson, 35, Jason Gibson, 31 and Richard Booth, 35.

(Image: Essex Live WS)

The Gibson brothers were found in a flat in the town centre and Mr Booth was discovered in a car to the rear of the building.

A post-mortem examination revealed the men died as a result of multiple stab wounds.

Detectives from Essex Police are continuing their investigation.

A police cordon remains in place in Wellesley Road while specialist teams search ten areas that are being treated as crime scenes.

Yesterday, forensic teams were searching drains in the street in a bid to find the murder weapon.

Colchester district commander, Chief Inspector Rob Huddleston, said: “I want to thank residents for their understanding, patience and co-operation while we continue to investigate the circumstances surrounding these tragic deaths.

(Image: PA)

“This incident has left our community shocked and saddened.

“We are treating it as a targeted and isolated incident. Those involved were well known to each other and we do not believe it was linked to any gang-related crime or drug use.

“Colchester is a safe place to live, work and socialise and we will continue to work with our partners to ensure this continues.

“We are carrying out extra patrols in the area and if you have any concerns, please don't hesitate to speak to one of my officers.”

Saunders will next appear in Chelmsford Crown Court tomorrow.
